rich_text.text: distinguish
sounds and intonation patterns
of english with increasing ease.

domain_objective_data.domain_objective_statement: distinguish sounds and intonation patterns of english with increasing ease

rich_text.text: practice producing sounds of newly acquired vocabulary
such as long and short vowels, silent letters, and consonant clusters to pronounce english words in a manner that is increasingly comprehensible.

rich_text.text: learn relationships between sounds and letters of the english language and decode (sound out) words using a combination of skills such as recognizing
sound-letter relationships and identifying cognates, affixes, roots, and base words.

domain_objective_data.domain_objective_statement: learn relationships between sounds and letters of the english language and decode (sound out) words using a combination of skills such as recognizing sound-letter relationships and identifying cognates, affixes, roots, and base words

language to represent sounds when writing in english.

rich_text.text: recognize elements of the
english sound system

rich_text.text: expand and internalize initial english vocabulary by learning and using high-frequency english words necessary for identifying and describing people, places, and objects, by
retelling simple stories and basic information represented or supported by pictures
, and by learning and using routine language needed for classroom communication.

domain_objective_data.domain_objective_statement: expand and internalize initial english vocabulary by learning and using high-frequency english words necessary for identifying and describing people, places, and objects, by retelling simple stories and basic information represented or supported by pictures, and by learning and using routine language needed for classroom communication

new language structures, expressions, and basic and academic vocabulary
heard during classroom instruction and interactions.

rich_text.text: speak using a variety of grammatical structures, sentence lengths, sentence types
, and connecting words with increasing accuracy and ease as more english is acquired.

during classroom instruction and interactions and seek clarification as needed.

build academic language proficiency

rich_text.text: use pre reading supports such as graphic organizers, illustrations, and pre taught topic
related vocabulary and other pre reading activities to enhance comprehension of written text.

rich_text.text: edit writing for
standard grammar and usage

commensurate with grade-level expectations as more english is acquired.

to enhance and confirm understanding of increasingly complex and elaborated spoken language.

area material with a decreasing need for linguistic accommodations as more english is learned.

rich_text.text: listen to and derive meaning from a variety of media
such as audio tape, video, etc., to build and reinforce concept and language attainment.

rich_text.text: ask and give information ranging from using a very limited bank of high-frequency, highneed, concrete vocabulary, including key words and expressions needed for basic communication in academic and social contexts, to
using abstract and content-based vocabulary during extended speaking assignments.

l to fulfill content area writing needs as more english is acquired.
